text: Marcgravia polyadenia is a species of plant in the Marcgraviaceae family. The flowering vine is endemic to Ecuador. ==Ecology== The plant's natural habitat is subtropical or tropical moist lowland forests. The green-crowned brilliant hummingbird feeds at the large inflorescences of the Marcgravia polyadenia vines. ==References == polyadenia Category:Endemic flora of Ecuador Category:Data deficient plants Category:Bird food plants Category:Vines Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Marcgravia polyadenia
